page.title: 01ROTHERHAM IS A LARGE TOWN...
page.content: Rotherham is a large town in South Yorkshire with a population of 250,000. It is the third largest of the four South Yorkshire Metropolitan Boroughs. It lies at the confluence of the rivers Don and Rother and has been renowned for its steel and iron production since Roman times. In recent years this has declined with the decrease in demand for manufactured goods. Sadly many businesses and small factory complexes have closed and with this there has been a rapid increase in unemployment figures. The town centre is now greatly modernised with many new buildings such as Hillards and the new Cascade Centre, and there is a new General Hospital. In comparison with these there are several historic places of interest such as the Chapel on the Bridge. The town has two parks.
